summary: In the U.S., about 30 million people—half of them children—have a rare disease. Many of these diseases are chronic, worsen over time, and are life-threatening. It can take years of testing and misdiagnoses to get a correct diagnosis; in that time, a patient's health can get worse. Partly due to the difficulty of diagnosing rare diseases, the costs related to them are hard to track...
title: Rare Diseases: Although Limited, Available Evidence Suggests Medical and Other Costs Can Be Substantial
